intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides var. elatius, commonly known as the tall buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Central Asia. It features a basal rosette of pinnately lobed leaves and produces yellow flowers with five petals arranged in a raceme. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
